abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo unveils plan to reduce number of new AIDS cases in state to 750 from 3,000 by 2020; plan, which is not yet funded, would include increased testing and aggressive use of antiretroviral drugs.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo’s blueprint, including a package of new laws and a more aggressive use of antiretroviral drugs, brought cheers from some activists, if no guarantee it will come to fruition.

headline.main: Cuomo Announces Plan to Cut New AIDS Cases in New York
headline.print_headline: Cuomo Announces a Plan to Sharply Reduce New AIDS Cases

snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo’s blueprint, including a package of new laws and a more aggressive use of antiretroviral drugs, brought cheers from some activists, if no guarantee it will come to fruition.
